formatDescription: Part of the PostScript Type 1 font format family. On Windows, Type 1 fonts consist of a PostScript Font Binary (.PFB) file, plus a corresponding PostScript Font Metrics (.PFM) file. (Some very old Type 1 fonts may ship with a .PFB, .AFM, and .INF file. Installing such fonts will create a .PFM file from the .AFM and .INF files.)
provenanceCompoundName: The Borthwick Institute for Archives / The Borthwick Institute for Archives

internalSignatures.name: Adobe PFM
internalSignatures.note: BOF: (..{64}....,.,.{43}..) - 117 byte header: 2byte 'dfVersion', then after Length and Copyright string, 8 bytes (dfType, dfPoint, dfVertRes, dfHorizRes), then first two bytes after the header represent first PFM extension, 'dfSizeFields'
